item.title: Danez Smith on Individuality
item.author: blog@tuirgin.com (Christopher D. Walborn)
item.description: This does not hit close to home. It’s dead-on, right to the face. Smith confirms the “value of community for the marginalised” before letting slip: “You don’t have the luxury of being an individual.” That seems a hell of a thing to say… “I mean it. To be black, queer or poor – to be an individual has always meant death for us. To be a woman alone is dangerous – we teach our daughters that, we teach black people that.
